what: Build pretty bar plots fast — ppp_barplot
title: Build pretty bar plots fast — ppp_barplot
text: function produce bar plots using ggplot2 theme, colors, counts (percentages)

title: Build pretty bar plots fast — ppp_barplot
Build pretty bar plots fast — ppp_barplot
text: data data frame containing variables plotted x_var categorical variable data frame used create bar plot colors character vector color names, number colors provided must match number unique categories x_var variable

title: Build pretty bar plots fast — ppp_barplot
text: visually appealing bar plot displaying counts percentages category x_var, values printed directly plot

title: Build pretty bar plots fast — ppp_barplot
code: my_colors <- c("#E09F3E", "#9E2A2B", "#540B0E", "#335C67") ppp_barplot(data = dplyr::starwars, x_var = "sex", colors = my_colors)  ppp_barplot(data = iris, x_var = "Species", colors = c("#337495", "#002a33", "#2f5a69"))

what: Build pretty box plots fast — ppp_boxplot
title: Build pretty box plots fast — ppp_boxplot
text: function produce box plots using ggplot2 theme, colors, statistics

title: Build pretty box plots fast — ppp_boxplot
code: ppp_boxplot(data, x_var, y_var, comparisons, colors, method)

title: Build pretty box plots fast — ppp_boxplot
text: data data frame containing variables plotted analyzed x_var categorical variable data frame used grouping x-axis y_var numeric variable data frame plotted y-axis comparisons list specifying pairs categories x_var compared statistically colors character vector color names, number colors provided must match number unique categories x_var variable method statistical method used comparing groups specified comparisons (e.g., "wilcox.test", "t.test")

title: Build pretty box plots fast — ppp_boxplot
text: visually appealing, colored box plot y_var grouped x_var, statistical comparisons specified groups (comparisons) displayed plot, using specified method. plot customized colors provided colors vector

title: Build pretty box plots fast — ppp_boxplot
code: my_comparisons <- list(c("female", "hermaphroditic"), c("female", "male"), c("female", "none")) my_colors <- c("#E09F3E", "#9E2A2B", "#540B0E", "#335C67") my_method <- "wilcox.test" ppp_boxplot(data = dplyr::starwars,             x_var = "sex",              y_var = "height",              comparisons = my_comparisons,              colors = my_colors,              method = my_method) #> Warning: Removed 6 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range #> (`stat_boxplot()`). #> Warning: Removed 6 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range (`stat_signif()`). #> Warning: cannot compute exact p-value with ties #> Warning: cannot compute exact p-value with ties #> Warning: Removed 6 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`).  ppp_boxplot(data = iris,              x_var = "Species",              y_var = "Sepal.Length",              comparisons = list(c("setosa", "versicolor"), c("setosa", "virginica")),             colors = c("#337495", "#002a33", "#2f5a69"),             method = "wilcox.test")
